items.title: VI Live: Saibari en Salah-Eddine in de basis, √©√©n Boxing Day-duel in Manchester
items.summary: Traditiegetrouw wordt er in Engeland gevoetbald op Boxing Day. Ditmaal geen uitgebreid programma, maar slechts √©√©n duel: Manchester United tegen Newcastle United. Daarnaast speelt Marokko om 21.00 uur in de Afrika Cup tegen Mali. Volg de duels in deze VI Live.

items.title: Manchester United v Newcastle: Premier League ‚Äì live
items.summary: ‚öΩ Premier League updates from the 8pm GMT kick-off ‚öΩ Live scores | Table | Mail Scott The rewards on offer tonight. Seventh-placed Manchester United will leapfrog their old north-west pals Liverpool into fifth place with a win. Newcastle start the game in the bottom half of the table, but should they win by two goals this evening, they‚Äôll nip in ahead of Manchester United and into seventh. Any victory would take Newcastle above Crystal Palace and into eighth. Manchester United make two changes to their starting XI following the 2-1 defeat at Aston Villa. Bruno Fernandes is injured, so his captain‚Äôs armband is taken by Lisandro Mart√≠nez, making his first start since his return from injury. Casemiro takes Fernandes‚Äôs place in midfield, returning as he is from a one-match suspension. Leny Yoro drops to the bench. Continue reading...

items.title: Mart√≠nez krijgt bij basisrentree gelijk aanvoerdersband van Manchester United
items.summary: Lisandro Mart√≠nez heeft bij zijn rentree in de basis voor Manchester United direct de aanvoerdersband gekregen van trainer R√∫ben Amorim. De voormalig Ajacied is daarmee de vervanger van de geblesseerde Bruno Fernandes voor het Boxing Day-duel met Newcastle United.

items.title: Ongeloof bij Zuid-Afrika na penalty's tegen Egypte: 'Het slaat nergens op'
items.summary: Bondscoach Hugo Broos van Zuid-Afrika was na afloop van de verloren wedstrijd tegen Egypte ( 1-0 ) furieus op de arbitrage nadat een strafschop in de blessuretijd niet werd toegekend.

items.title: Forest to rename stand in honour of Robertson
items.summary: Nottingham Forest are to rename a stand at the City Ground to honour their "great hero" John Robertson, who died at the age of 72 this week.

items.title: Waarom er dit jaar maar √©√©n wedstrijd op Boxing Day is
items.summary: Boxing Day wordt traditioneel gezien als een van de hoogtepunten van de Premier League, maar het heeft er alle schijn van dat op tweede kerstdag slechts √©√©n wedstrijd wordt gespeeld. Dat heeft te maken met de uitzendrechten.

items.title: Edinburgh derby, Askou & Hatate in spotlight
items.summary: Who will triumph in the second Edinburgh derby of the season? Will Motherwell manager Jens Berthel Askou make it 11 league matches unbeaten? And will Celtic midfielder Reo Hatate continue his excellent creative output?

items.title: Investeerders naar Nederland? 'Zit te wachten tot Tony Bloom zich meldt in Eredivisie'
items.summary: Voormalig FC Groningen-directeur Wouter Gudde signaleert dat het Nederlandse voetbal kansen misloopt door onaantrekkelijk te zijn voor investeerders. Het is door strikte licentieregels ingewikkeld om een club te kopen.

items.title: Championship roundup: Coventry go eight points clear while Leicester lose again
items.summary: Ipswich and Millwall draw; Bristol City beat Albion Oxford shock Saints; Pompey denied by QPR Coventry stretched their lead at the top of the Championship to eight points after a hard-fought 1-0 win over Swansea. Ephron Mason-Clark‚Äôs emphatic finish just before half-time was enough to give Frank Lampard‚Äôs side a ninth home Championship win of the season. But the usually free-scoring Sky Blues were made to work hard for the points and were perhaps somewhat fortunate to have found themselves in front at half-time. The resolute visitors had done a fine job in keeping the hosts quiet but were undone a minute before the break by Mason-Clark‚Äôs opener. Continue reading...

items.title: Cautious Middlesbrough lose ground on leaders with goalless Blackburn draw
items.summary: Kim Hellberg‚Äôs determination to succeed as Middlesbrough manager runs deep. So deep that he decided it would be best if his wife and two small children spent Christmas in their native Sweden while he continued to put in long days on Teesside. Given that the Hellberg family will soon be reunited in a new home in North Yorkshire and Blackburn‚Äôs visit represented the first of four games in nine days it seemed a sensible sacrifice ‚Äì even if such pragmatism failed to pay the desired Boxing Day dividends. The former Hammarby head coach had hoped to celebrate the completion of his first month in charge at the Riverside Stadium after succeeding the Wolves-bound Rob Edwards with three points but Blackburn, and their irrepressible midfielder Todd Cantwell in particular, had different ideas. Continue reading...

items.title: Afcon roundup: Mohamed Salah strikes again as 10-man Egypt hold off South Africa
items.summary: Salah penalty gives Egypt second win in two Angola and Zimbabwe battle to 1-1 draw Mohamed Salah scored a first-half penalty as 10-man Egypt defeated South Africa 1-0 in their Africa Cup of Nations Group B clash in Agadir on Friday to become the first team into the knockout stages of the competition. Egypt have six points from their opening two games and cannot finish outside of the top two in the group. South Africa have three points from their two games, while Zimbabwe and Angola have one each after they drew 1-1 earlier in the day. Continue reading...

items.title: Salah scores again as 10-man Egypt hold on against South Africa
items.summary: Mohamed Salah scored again as 10-man Egypt secured top spot in Group B of the Africa Cup of Nations with a 1-0 win against South Africa.

items.title: PL Predictions: Cunha or nothing for Man Utd? Nothing it is
items.summary: Our football betting expert Jones Knows called nine out of 10 match results correct last weekend. He is back to offer his insight...

items.title: The best teams in Europe right now: Can anyone stop Bayern or Arsenal?
items.summary: As we celebrate the festive season, what better gift than a rerank of the best, most in-form teams across Europe's top five leagues?

items.title: How much is each position in soccer worth? A deep dive into the Premier League
items.summary: Are attackers the most valuable players in soccer? The answer is obvious and impossible -- at the same time.

items.title: Arteta 'hacked off' by Rice's time-wasting red card
items.summary: Mikel Arteta has revealed he was "hacked off" by Arsenal's draw with Brighton & Hove Albionlast season but hailed his side's improved disciplinary record this term.

items.title: Slot needed to 'convince' Ekitike to reach best form
items.summary: Liverpool striker Hugo Ekitike's five goals in four matches suggest he is starting to get to grips with the Premier League but head coach Arne Slot admits he had to push the player to reach his current levels.

items.title: Forest's 'greatest' John Robertson dies at 72
items.summary: Former Nottingham Forest and Scotland winger John Robertson has died at the age of 72, the Premier League club have announced.

items.title: Man City players 'incredibly disciplined' - Guardiola
items.summary: Pep Guardiola says his players will have remained "incredibly disciplined" during the Christmas break to meet the standards Manchester City have set.

items.title: The Jukebox Man lands thrilling King George success for Redknapp
items.summary: The Jukebox Man, carrying the colours of former Premier League manager Harry Redknapp, came out on top in an epic renewal of the Ladbrokes King George VI Chase at Kempton Park.
